titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Proposed Ronald Reagan Library at Stanford Records
Proposed Ronald Reagan Library at Stanford Records
titlestmt.author: Daniel Hartwig

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.unittitle: Proposed Ronald Reagan Library at Stanford records
did.abstract: Correspondence, memoranda, reports, feasibility studies, and site plan analyses compiled for the President's advisory group on the proposed Ronald Reagan Library complex at Stanford University. Included are correspondence, reports, and articles pertaining to presidential libraries at other universities; and letters from Stanford faculty voicing their position on the proposed complex.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Proposed Ronald Reagan Library at Stanford :. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memoranda, reports, feasibility studies, and site plan analyses compiled for the President's advisory group on the proposed Ronald Reagan Library complex at Stanford University. Included are correspondence, reports, and articles pertaining to presidential libraries at other universities; and letters from Stanford faculty voicing their position on the proposed complex.

did.unittitle: Academic Council Response to the President's Advisory Group on the Proposed Ronald Reagan Library Complex
Reagan Library 1 (Volume II: Letters and Papers Confidential to the President's Advisory Group on the Proposed RRL Complex) External Advice on Project
Reagan Library 2 (Volume I) Internal Correspondence, Meeting Notes, Faculty and Alumni Comments
